bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, May 16, 1947

div1.p: Hench informs Nogueira that he is gratified that the Cuban government has designated Camp Lazear Building No. 1 as a national monument. He will join the Cubans in an effort to properly memorialize the work of Finlay and the Americans.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, May 16, 1947
div1.opener:
May 16, 1947
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
General Director of Sanitation
Republic of Cuba
Havana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Nogueira:
div1.p:
I am delighted to have received your most interesting
letter of April 22nd and I apologize for my delay in answering
it. I have been attending medical meetings and have been away
from Rochester.

The information given in your letter and in one I
have just received from Doctor Jose R. Andreu pleases me greatly.
I am most gratified that the Cuban Government has designated as
a National monument the Caseta on the Finca San Jose.

I have just written a long reply to Doctor Andreu.
Would you permit me to answer your letter by enclosing a copy
of my letter him.

I shall be most happy to join you, Doctor Andreu,
and others in an effort to memorialize properly the magnificent
work of Doctor Finlay and of the American Commission. I shall
await with interest further communication from you.

closer.seg: P. S. I enclose a reprint which may interest you.
